intro: Echinocoryne stricta, commonly known as the rigid echinocoryne, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It features upright, branching stems covered in small, spiny tubercles, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in dense clusters, typically blooming in late spring. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, with a rough texture. Echinocoryne stricta is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments.
